SR-001.name: Is AI System
SR-001.description: Machine-based system designed to operate with autonomy and infer how to generate outputs
SR-001.question: Is this an AI system as defined in Article 3(1)?

SR-002.name: Is Provider
SR-002.description: Natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body that develops an AI system or has it developed and places it on market or puts it into service under own name or trademark
SR-002.question: Are you the provider of this AI system?

SR-003.name: Is Deployer
SR-003.description: Natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body using AI system under its authority (except for personal non-professional activity)
SR-003.question: Are you the deployer (user) of this AI system?

SR-004.name: Is High-Risk
SR-004.description: System classified as high-risk per Article 6 pathways
SR-004.question: Is the AI system classified as high-risk?

SR-004a.name: Product Safety Pathway
SR-004a.description: System is safety component of product under Annex I legislation requiring third-party conformity assessment

SR-004b.name: Annex III Pathway
SR-004b.description: System falls under Annex III high-risk use cases (subject to Article 6(3) opt-out)

SR-004b-1.name: Annex III Use Case
SR-004b-1.description: System matches one of 28 use cases in Annex III (biometrics, critical infrastructure, education, employment, public services, law enforcement, migration, justice)

SR-004b-2.name: Article 6(3) Opt-Out NOT Applied
SR-004b-2.description: Provider has NOT concluded system is non-high-risk per Article 6(3) conditions

SR-005.name: System Placed on Market or Put Into Service
SR-005.description: AI system has been made available on Union market or put into service

SR-006.name: Is General-Purpose AI Model Provider
SR-006.description: Provider of AI model trained on large amounts of data using self-supervision at scale, capable of competently performing wide range of distinct tasks

SR-007.name: Is Importer
SR-007.description: Natural or legal person established in Union placing on market AI system bearing name/trademark of person established in third country

SR-008.name: Is Distributor
SR-008.description: Natural or legal person in supply chain (other than provider/importer) making AI system available on Union market

SR-009.name: Third-Country Establishment
SR-009.description: Provider/model provider established in third country (non-EU)

SR-010.name: Is Systemic Risk Model
SR-010.description: General-purpose AI model with high impact capabilities (>10^25 FLOPs presumption) OR Commission decision based on Annex XIII criteria

SR-010a.name: High Impact Capabilities
SR-010a.description: Model has high impact capabilities (>10^25 FLOPs training computation presumption)

SR-010b.name: Commission Decision
SR-010b.description: Commission ex officio or following scientific panel alert decided model has equivalent capabilities/impact per Annex XIII

W-001.name: AI Literacy Obligation
W-001.consequence: Must ensure AI literacy of staff/persons dealing with operation and use of AI system

conditions.description: Has staff or persons dealing with operation or use of AI system
conditions.question: Do you have staff or persons dealing with the operation or use of this AI system?

W-002a.name: Prohibition - Subliminal Manipulation
W-002a.consequence: Cannot place on market, put into service, or use

conditions.description: Deploys subliminal techniques beyond person's consciousness OR manipulative/deceptive techniques
conditions.question: Does the system use subliminal techniques beyond consciousness or manipulative/deceptive techniques?

conditions.description: Objective or effect: materially distort behaviour by appreciably impairing informed decision-making
conditions.question: Does this cause material distortion of behaviour by impairing decision-making ability?

conditions.description: Causes person to take decision they wouldn't otherwise take
conditions.question: Does this lead people to make decisions they wouldn't otherwise make?

conditions.description: Causes or likely to cause significant harm to person or another person
conditions.question: Does this cause or is it likely to cause significant harm?

W-003b.name: High-Risk Classification - Annex III Pathway
W-003b.consequence: System classified as high-risk → triggers obligations W-007 through W-031, W-046 through W-049

conditions.description: Article 6(3) opt-out NOT claimed OR opt-out invalid
conditions.question: Has provider concluded system is NOT high-risk per Article 6(3)? (If yes, this requirement fails)

conditions.description: System performs one of the opt-out eligible functions
Narrow procedural task (improve result of human activity, detect decision-making patterns, prepare task)
Improvement of prior human activity
Detect decision-making patterns without replacement/influence
Preparatory task
System does NOT perform profiling

W-007.name: Risk Management System
W-007.consequence: Must establish, implement, document, and maintain risk management system
obligations: Identify and analyze known and reasonably foreseeable risks
Estimate and evaluate risks from intended use and reasonably foreseeable misuse
Evaluate risks based on data gathering and analysis
Continuous iterative process throughout system lifecycle
Ensure residual risks are communicated to deployer
Testing to identify most appropriate risk management measures
Eliminate/reduce risks through adequate design and development
Implement adequate mitigation and control measures
Provide adequate information and training to deployer
Consider technical state of the art

W-014.name: Provider Core Obligations - High-Risk Systems
W-014.consequence: Must fulfill 12 core obligations before and after placing system on market

obligations.description: Ensure compliance with Chapter III Section 2 requirements
Establish quality management system
Draw up technical documentation + keep 10 years
Ensure automatic logging capabilities when under provider control
Keep logs (if under provider control) for period appropriate to intended purpose, minimum 6 months
Ensure system undergoes conformity assessment before placing on market/putting into service
Register system per Article 49
Take corrective actions if system non-compliant
Inform distributors, importers, deployers, authorities of non-compliance and risks
Affix CE marking to demonstrate conformity
Demonstrate conformity with requirements upon reasoned request
Ensure system accompanied by EU declaration of conformity

W-024.name: Deployer Core Obligations - High-Risk Systems
W-024.consequence: Must fulfill 12 obligations when deploying high-risk AI systems

obligations.description: Use system according to instructions for use
Assign human oversight to competent natural persons
Ensure input data quality and relevance
Monitor system operation based on instructions
Keep logs for minimum 6 months (or longer per applicable law)
Use systems in workplace only after informing workers/representatives (subject to Article 26(6) exceptions)
If public authority/EU institution/body deploying Annex III system: register and register use in EU database
Perform fundamental rights impact assessment (FRIA) if deployer is public body, providing public services, or deploying specific systems per Article 27(1)
If using real-time remote biometric ID in public: obtain authorization per Article 26(10)
Inform natural persons they are subject to use of high-risk system
Cooperate with authorities
Suspend system use if identified serious risk

W-038.name: General-Purpose AI Model - Core Obligations

obligations.description: Draw up and keep up-to-date technical documentation (Annex XI) for AI Office/national authorities on request
Draw up and make available information/documentation to downstream AI system providers (Annex XII) to understand capabilities/limitations
Put in place policy to comply with EU copyright law (including Directive 2019/790 Article 4(3) reservation of rights)
Draw up and make publicly available detailed summary of training content per AI Office template

open_source.description: Obligations (a) and (b) do NOT apply to free and open-source models with publicly available parameters/weights/architecture/usage
open_source.exception_to_exception: UNLESS model is systemic risk model (then all obligations apply)

W-038.compliance_facilitation: May rely on codes of practice (Article 56) or harmonised standards to demonstrate compliance

W-040.name: Systemic Risk Model - Additional Obligations
W-040.consequence: Must fulfill 4 additional obligations (in addition to W-038)

obligations.description: Perform model evaluation per standardised protocols + conduct and document adversarial testing to identify/mitigate systemic risks
Assess and mitigate possible systemic risks at Union level from development/placing on market/use
Track, document, and report without undue delay to AI Office (and national authorities as appropriate) serious incidents + possible corrective measures
Ensure adequate cybersecurity protection for model and physical infrastructure

W-040.compliance_facilitation: May rely on codes of practice (Article 56) until harmonised standards published

W-041.name: Real-World Testing Requirements
W-041.consequence: Must meet 11 cumulative conditions to conduct real-world testing

conditions.description: Is prospective provider (developing system not yet placed on market)
Testing conducted outside AI regulatory sandbox
Before placing on market or putting into service

mandatory_conditions.description: Drew up real-world testing plan and submitted to market surveillance authority
Market surveillance authority approved testing (or tacit approval after 30 days)
Registered testing in EU database with unique ID (or secure section for law enforcement/migration/asylum/border, or national for employment)
Provider established in EU OR appointed legal representative in EU
Data transferred to third countries only with appropriate safeguards per EU law
Testing duration max 6 months (extendable +6 months with notification)
Deployers informed of all relevant aspects + given instructions + agreement specifying roles/responsibilities
Subjects gave informed consent per Article 61 (exception: law enforcement if consent would prevent testing, no negative effects, data deleted)
Testing effectively overseen by suitably qualified persons with necessary capacity/training/authority
AI predictions/recommendations/decisions can be effectively reversed and disregarded

W-046.name: Post-Market Monitoring System
W-046.consequence: Must establish and document post-market monitoring system + plan
obligations: Establish post-market monitoring system proportionate to AI technology nature and risks
Actively and systematically collect, document, analyze data on performance throughout system lifetime
Evaluate continuous compliance with Chapter III Section 2 requirements
Include analysis of interaction with other AI systems where relevant
Base system on post-market monitoring plan (part of technical documentation per Annex IV)
Follow Commission template (to be adopted by 2 Feb 2026)

integration_options.product_safety_legislation: May integrate into existing monitoring systems under Annex I legislation if equivalent protection
integration_options.financial_services: Financial institutions may use existing governance systems under EU financial services law

W-047.name: Serious Incident Reporting
W-047.consequence: Must report serious incidents to market surveillance authorities

conditions.description: Serious incident occurred

timing.standard: Immediately after establishing causal link (or reasonable likelihood), max 15 days after becoming aware
timing.widespread_serious: Immediately, max 2 days after becoming aware (Article 3(49)(b) incidents)
timing.death: Immediately after establishing/suspecting causal relationship, max 10 days after becoming aware

reporting_procedure: Report immediately after establishing causal link (or reasonable likelihood)
May submit incomplete initial report followed by complete report if necessary for timeliness
Severity of incident determines reporting period

limited_reporting_systems.existing_eu_reporting: Systems under other EU law with equivalent reporting: limited to Article 3(49)(c) incidents only
limited_reporting_systems.medical_devices: Medical device high-risk AI (Regulations 2017/745, 2017/746): limited to Article 3(49)(c) incidents

W-049.name: Right to Explanation
W-049.consequence: Must provide clear and meaningful explanations of AI role in decision-making + main decision elements

conditions.description: System listed in Annex III (except point 2 employment systems)
conditions.question: Is the system listed in Annex III areas 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, or 8? (NOT area 2 employment)

conditions.description: Decision taken by deployer on basis of system output
conditions.question: Was a decision taken based on the AI system's output?

conditions.description: Decision produces legal effects OR similarly significantly affects person
conditions.question: Does the decision produce legal effects OR significantly affect the person?

conditions.description: Decision produces legal effects
Decision similarly significantly affects person
Person considers decision has adverse impact on health, safety, or fundamental rights
conditions.question: Does the affected person consider there is an adverse impact on their health, safety, or fundamental rights?

conditions.description: Affected person requests explanation
conditions.question: Has the affected person requested an explanation?

explanation_content: Clear and meaningful explanation of AI system's role in decision-making procedure

exceptions.union_national_law: Does not apply where Union or national law provides exceptions/restrictions (in compliance with EU law)
exceptions.other_eu_law: Only applies to extent right not otherwise provided under Union law
